metadata.title: CVE-2021-44224 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A crafted URI sent to httpd configured as a forward proxy (ProxyRequestson) can cause a crash (NULL pointer dereference) or, for configurationsmixing forward and reverse proxy declarations, can allow for requests to bedirected to a declared Unix Domain Socket endpoint (Server Side RequestForgery). This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.7 up to 2.4.51(included).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44224` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm4
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm4
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm4
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm4
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm4
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm4').
